API Documentation¶

Models.py¶

class apps.scorecard.models.Frame(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Represents a bowling frame, which consists of two turns per frame. A scorecard will have between 10 and 12 frames

class apps.scorecard.models.Game(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

The game model is essentially the root model of the application, and represents a bowling game

class apps.scorecard.models.IntegerRangeField(verbose_name=None, name=None, min_value=None, max_value=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Custom field type to support max/min integer values

class apps.scorecard.models.ScoreCard(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Represents a score card (i.e.player) with aggregated metrics about a player’s performance in a game
